title.native: 名探偵コナン　水平線上の陰謀
title.romaji: Meitantei Conan: Suihei Senjou no Sutoratejii
title.english: Case Closed: Strategy Above the Depths

description:
15 years ago, Daiichi Yachiyo Maru, a cargo ship, was crashed into a large iceberg in northern the Pacific Ocean, and sank. The captain and a crew were died.

Now, in Nishitama, a ship designer of Yatsushiro Shipbuilder, which belonged to Yatsushiro Financial Combine, was suffered from a sudden heart attack while he was driving, and died in a traffic accident.

Six months has passed since then. Conan, Ran, and Kogoro are enjoying their trip in the Aphrodite. The Aphrodite is a luxury liner, and it is sailing for the Pacific Ocean as its maiden voyage. However, there is a suspicious person, and finally a murder occurs.

It is the beginning of a horrible plot occurred in the ocean where there is no place to escape from.

(Source: AnimeNfo)
synonyms: Detective Conan: Strategy Above the Depths
Meitantei Conan Movie 09: Suihei Senjou no Sutoratejii
Detektiv Conan: Das Komplott über dem Ozean
Detective Conan Movie 09: La strategia degli Abissi

title.native: 名探偵コナン

node.description:
__Favorite Food:__ Rice with curry

Gosho Aoyama, alternatively known by his real name Yoshimasa Aoyama, is a Japanese mangaka and animator, best known as the creator of Detective Conan (internationally known as Case Closed), Magic Kaito, and YAIBA.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E3%81%93%E3%81%A0%E3%81%BE%E5%85%BC%E5%97%A3) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kenji_Kodama)

Kenji Kodama is a Japanese director and storyboard artist. He is best known for being one of the main directors on the long-running anime [Detective Conan](https://anilist.co/anime/235/), as well as the [City Hunter](https://anilist.co/anime/1470/) series and [Lupin III: Part III](https://anilist.co/anime/1426/).

Married to animator [Sachiko Kamimura](https://anilist.co/staff/112663/).

(Source: Wikipedia)

Affiliated with Studio Live. Admires [Kazuko Tadano](https://anilist.co/staff/118426/).

Her designs are very shoujo manga like, often featuring glittering eyes.
_Note: Not to be confused with the [voice actress](https://anilist.co/staff/197781/)._

[Website](https://wezard.net/) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Izumi_Sakai) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/坂井泉水)

Sachiko Kamachi, known professionally as Izumi Sakai, was a female Japanese pop singer, songwriter, and member of the group Zard. As Sakai was the only member who stayed in the group while others joined and left regularly, Zard and Sakai may be referred to interchangeably. She was the best-selling female recording artist of the 1990s and has sold over 37 million copies of sales, making her one of the best-selling music artists in Japan of all time.

Sakai produced 42 singles as well as 11 albums and 5 compilations in her lifetime. In addition to "Makenaide," she produced two other singles that sold over a million copies. Six of her albums as well as her first three compilations also surpassed the one-million mark. Sakai's CD sales had been in decline since 2000, but her death triggered an increase in CD sales.

 In June 2006, she was diagnosed with cervical cancer, for which she immediately underwent treatment. She appeared to have healed, but discovered that her cancer had spread to her lungs, indicating a Stage 4 cancer. She began undergoing treatment at Keio University Hospital in April 2007 but she never fully recovered. Sakai died on May 27, 2007 due to an accidental fall at the hospital where she was undergoing chemotherapy.

(Source: Wikipedia)
Yamamoto Yasuichirou is a director. He is best known as the current director of the Meitantei Conan franchise.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/mariko_itoh222) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/okome2014/)

In 2008, she married fellow animator [Tatsufumi Tamakawa](https://anilist.co/staff/109607/Tatsufumi-Itou), who changed his name to Tatsufumi Itou after marrying her. 

Her husband passed away from a brain hemorrhage on May 23, 2020.

[Website](https://wezard.net/) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Izumi_Sakai) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/坂井泉水)

Sachiko Kamachi, known professionally as Izumi Sakai, was a female Japanese pop singer, songwriter, and member of the group Zard. As Sakai was the only member who stayed in the group while others joined and left regularly, Zard and Sakai may be referred to interchangeably. She was the best-selling female recording artist of the 1990s and has sold over 37 million copies of sales, making her one of the best-selling music artists in Japan of all time.

Sakai produced 42 singles as well as 11 albums and 5 compilations in her lifetime. In addition to "Makenaide," she produced two other singles that sold over a million copies. Six of her albums as well as her first three compilations also surpassed the one-million mark. Sakai's CD sales had been in decline since 2000, but her death triggered an increase in CD sales.

 In June 2006, she was diagnosed with cervical cancer, for which she immediately underwent treatment. She appeared to have healed, but discovered that her cancer had spread to her lungs, indicating a Stage 4 cancer. She began undergoing treatment at Keio University Hospital in April 2007 but she never fully recovered. Sakai died on May 27, 2007 due to an accidental fall at the hospital where she was undergoing chemotherapy.

(Source: Wikipedia)
__Takeshi Hayama__ is a composer, arranger and guitarist from Osaka Prefecture.

__Birth Name:__ Izumi Arai (新井泉)

[Profile (81 Produce)](https://www.81produce.co.jp/actor_search/index.php/item?id=237) | [Official blog](https://ameblo.jp/number-373/)

The female half of the musical duo [TWO-MIX](https://anilist.co/staff/102352/).

Married mangaka [Gosho Aoyama](https://anilist.co/staff/97804/) (creator of _Detective Conan_) on her birthday, May 5, in 2005. Later divorced on December 10, 2007.

**Non-Anime Roles:**
• Fu Hua (Honkai Impact 3rd)

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/須藤昌朋)

Originating from Studio Annapuru, currently freelance.

Debuted as an in-betweener on the second season of [Ashita no Joe](https://anilist.co/anime/2921/). He is particularly known for his involvement in [TMS Entertainment's](https://anilist.co/studio/73/) works, mainly the [Detective Conan](https://anilist.co/anime/235/) franchise, in which he has served as a character designer and animation director on all of the theatrical movies.
